attributes.action: scrap the Report produced by the Consultative Group on the Past
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The CGP was co-chaired by Robin Eames and Denis Bradley and their Report was published in January 2009. The inherent recommendation to equate the pain and suffering of "perpetrators" with that of "victims" has caused widespread anger and disbelief across the community.

"We the undersigned will not buy into any process, which would result in an amnesty being given to ruthless terrorists nor will we support a “recognition payment” being made, which equates; “terrorist” experiences with that of the innocent victims whom they perpetrated crime against.” 

“We call on the Westminster Government to kick the report into touch and begin to address the cries of innocent victims who up until now have been denied truth and justice.”

rejection.details: Please see this news article from the Northern Ireland Office: http://www.nio.gov.uk/woodward-rules-out-12-000-recognition-payment/media-detail.htm?newsID=15892
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
